intro: Nothoscordum moconense, commonly known as the Mexican garlic plant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stem and fragrant, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild garlic-like scent. Nothoscordum moconense is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil.
